metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1322 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Directory traversal vulnerability in the Ubuntu network-manager package for Ubuntu (vivid) before 0.9.10.0-4ubuntu15.1, Ubuntu 14.10 before 0.9.8.8-0ubuntu28.1, and Ubuntu 14.04 LTS before 0.9.8.8-0ubuntu7.1 allows local users to change the modem device configuration or read arbitrary files via a .. (dot dot) in the file name in a request to read modem device contexts (com.canonical.NMOfono.ReadImsiContexts).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1322` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-networkmanager-1.0 - 0.9.8.8-0ubuntu7.1
libnm-glib-vpn1 - 0.9.8.8-0ubuntu7.1
libnm-glib4 - 0.9.8.8-0ubuntu7.1
libnm-util2 - 0.9.8.8-0ubuntu7.1
network-manager - 0.9.8.8-0ubuntu7.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> issue in ubuntu-specific ofono integration patch

criterions.comment: network-manager package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.8.8-0ubuntu7.1').
